intro: Hieracium zizianum subsp. subcoarctatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a rough texture, and its flowers are yellow, forming dense clusters. It is a flowering plant that plays a role in pollination and is often found in alpine meadows.
